title: Add keyboard shortcuts + command palette for core actions
description:
Mission-control UX needs speed without mouse. Add a lightweight command palette (⌘K / Ctrl+K) and a few global shortcuts.

Commands:
- New Agent
- Open Workspace Settings
- Toggle Archived
- Focus selected tile input / send
- Jump to agent by name

Implement:
- Minimal palette UI with fuzzy search over commands + agents.
- Document shortcuts in UI (help modal or footer link).

Acceptance:
- Ctrl/Cmd+K opens palette; ESC closes.
- Commands execute and focus returns appropriately.

Verify:
- Manual: run through command list; e2e test if feasible.
close_reason: Removed per George request (not pursuing command palette right now).

title: Improve empty states + onboarding when workspace/gateway missing
description:
Right now, several flows fail via disabled buttons or alerts. We should guide first-time users:

Cases:
- Gateway disconnected/connecting
- Workspace path not set / invalid
- No tiles/projects yet

Implement:
- A top-level banner/panel that explains current blockers (e.g. "Gateway disconnected: start openclaw gateway") with a copy-to-clipboard command button.
- A dedicated empty-state view with a single primary CTA (Set Workspace / New Agent) depending on state.
- Inline validation + helper copy in WorkspaceSettingsPanel (path exists? permissions?)

Acceptance:
- No silent failure: user always sees what to do next.
- All primary CTAs are contextual and available via keyboard focus.

Verify:
- Manual: start UI with gateway off; see instructions.
- Manual: blank workspace; see onboarding empty state.

title: Document repo-scoped Beads + PR workflow in OpenClaw Studio CONTRIBUTING
description:
Goal: Ensure contributors understand that tasks are tracked with repo-scoped Beads and changes flow via PRs.

Context: We are adopting a multi-agent operating model; Beads live in the repo (.beads/) and are exported to .beads/issues.jsonl before commits.

Approach: Update CONTRIBUTING.md (or README.md if more appropriate) with a short section describing: br init, br create, br sync --flush-only, one-bead-one-PR.

Acceptance:
- Docs mention where Beads live (.beads/ in repo)
- Docs mention exporting issues.jsonl before committing
- Docs mention one bead -> one PR

Verify:
- N/A (docs change)
close_reason: Done (docs updated; verify by reading CONTRIBUTING.md Task tracking (Beads) section)

title: Agent Inspect panel: split into tabs + add copy/search affordances
description:
The inspect panel currently stacks Activity + Brain files + Settings + Heartbeat in one long scroll. It’s powerful but hard to scan, and key actions (copy last result, search transcript, copy tool output) are missing.

Implement:
- Convert panel to tabbed sections: Activity / Brain / Settings (Heartbeat inside Settings or its own tab).
- Add "Copy last result" + "Copy session key" buttons.
- Add simple transcript search (client-side filter/highlight) + "Copy tool result" per tool block.
- Preserve current behavior (auto-scroll to bottom) but add "Pause autoscroll" toggle when user scrolls up.

Acceptance:
- No vertical mega-scroll; major sections are reachable in 1 click.
- Copy/search features work without breaking markdown rendering.

Verify:
- Manual: open inspect on active tile, search for a token, copy tool result.

title: Replace window.alert/confirm with in-app toasts + confirm dialog
description:
Current UX relies on window.alert/window.confirm (see src/app/page.tsx and WorkspaceSettingsPanel). This is jarring and blocks the UI.

Implement:
- Add a lightweight toast system (or use existing shadcn/ui toast if present) for info/warn/error.
- Add a reusable ConfirmDialog component for destructive actions (cleanup archived agents, etc.).
- Replace existing alert/confirm usages with toast + dialog and ensure errors surface with actionable copy.

Acceptance:
- No window.alert/window.confirm usage remains in src/ (rg check).
- Cleanup archived flow uses ConfirmDialog with clear copy + counts.
- Errors show non-blocking toast and also log to console/logger.

Verify:
- rg "window\.(alert|confirm)" src returns 0
- Manual: trigger each action and confirm UX

title: Header Actions menu: accessible dropdown (keyboard, outside-click, ARIA)
description:
HeaderBar uses a <details>/<summary> menu with a literal 'v' and no outside-click handling beyond manual close on button click. Improve discoverability + accessibility.

Implement:
- Replace with a proper dropdown/menu component (shadcn/ui DropdownMenu if available).
- Add ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and outside-click dismissal.
- Replace 'v' with an icon and keep summary label stable.

Acceptance:
- Menu is operable with keyboard only.
- Menu closes on outside click / ESC.
- Snapshot tests or e2e test covers open/close behavior (optional but preferred).
close_reason: Removed per George request (not pursuing header dropdown rework right now).

title: Define OpenClaw Studio mission control UX goals for multi-agent workflow
description:
Goal: Capture the UX goals for turning OpenClaw Studio into Mission Control for multiple agents/workspaces.

Context: We are adopting a multi-agent operating model (per-agent workspaces, repo-scoped Beads, shared brain under ~/.openclaw/shared).

Approach: Read existing ARCHITECTURE.md and current canvas/workspace code paths. Propose 2-3 UX options (workspace profiles, multi-project, per-tile workspace) and recommend a phased approach.

Acceptance:
- A short written recommendation posted in the Studio Research channel
- Identifies the smallest change that unlocks meaningful parallelism

Verify:
- N/A (research output)

comments.author: ubuntu
comments.text:
Research deliverable: UX goals + options for turning Studio into multi-agent Mission Control.

Top UX goals:
1) Make parallelism visible: at-a-glance which agents/workspaces are running, queued, blocked, and where their files live.
2) Reduce context bleed: make workspace boundaries explicit and easy to enforce (default workspace vs per-agent/per-tile).
3) Fast switching: jump between agents, sessions, and their artifacts (logs, Beads, files) in 1-2 clicks.
4) Safe ops: prevent accidental edits/deletes in the wrong workspace; confirm destructive actions with clear context (workspace + agent).
5) Scalable layout: support 5–50 agents via grouping, filtering, and status-first summaries (not full transcripts).

UX options (2–3):
A) Per-tile workspace override (smallest change): keep global Default Workspace, but allow each tile to set workspacePath override + show it as a badge in the tile header. New tiles default to global. Add quick actions: “Use default”, “Open folder”, “Copy path”.
B) Workspace Profiles: settings manages named profiles (e.g., studio-research, studio-engineer), each with workspacePath (+ optional defaults like model/agentId). Tiles select a profile. Provides consistency + avoids path typos.
C) Multi-project / multi-canvas: treat each workspace as a Project tab (each tab has its own canvas + tiles). Mission Control becomes a top-level project switcher with global overview.

Recommendation (phased):
Phase 1 (unlock parallelism quickly): implement A (per-tile workspace override + UI badge + quick open/copy). This immediately supports the multi-agent operating model (separate per-agent workspaces) without changing the rest of the store model.
Phase 2: add B (profiles) to reduce cognitive load and improve safety.
Phase 3: consider C for scale (many workspaces) + global overview panel.

Smallest meaningful change: per-tile workspacePath override + make it visually persistent in the tile so users can’t forget which workspace an agent is operating in.
